site_title: Jack Ma-backed Ant plans restructuring, paving way for Hong Kong IPO
summary: Ant Group, backed by Jack Ma, is planning a restructuring that may pave the way for a Hong Kong IPO. The company will break off non-core operations, including blockchain and international business, to focus on its China financial-related business. Ant has received shareholder approval to buy back shares at a valuation of about US$79 billion, and some Chinese state-owned firms may participate in the buyback. The move could provide relief to shareholders ensnared by the crackdown, but the years of scrutiny have taken a toll on the company's growth prospects.

images.alt_text: The Ant Group Co. mascot at the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, China. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

site_title: Chinese automakers sold 75% of EVs in South-east Asia in Q1: study
summary: Chinese automakers sold 75% of electric vehicles (EVs) in South-east Asia in the first quarter, according to Counterpoint Research. Thailand led the market, accounting for 79% of all EVs sold in the region, driven by incentives offered to consumers and subsidies to automakers. This has attracted investments from Chinese carmakers such as Great Wall Motor and BYD in local manufacturing.

images.alt_text: Six of the top 10 brands by market share in Russia are Chinese automakers, such as Haval, Chery and Geely, according to monthly sales data for June from Autostat.
Farizon, which started selling vehicles in 2016, sold roughly 37,800 light commercial vehicles in China in 2022, according to consultancy LMC Automotive.
The EV population is at its highest level to date, but still makes up only 1.3 per cent of the passenger car population.
Singapore electric scooter company Scorpio says it is in collaboration with Shenzhen BYD Electronics to produce pre-production prototypes of the X1.

“The sales volume of the company’s new energy vehicles has achieved strong growth from a high base in the same period last year, and continued to consolidate its leadership in new energy vehicle industry,” BYD says

site_title: Morgan Stanley lifts 2023 US growth forecast on expectation of infrastructure investment
summary: Morgan Stanley raised its US economic growth forecast for 2023 to 1.3% due to a strong industrial sector and increased public investment in infrastructure and nonresidential structures. This is a 0.7% increase from the earlier forecast. The bank attributes the revised forecast to a "comfortable soft landing" for the economy, driven by infrastructure investments and a slowdown in growth. This change in forecast follows Goldman Sachs' earlier reduction in the probability of a US recession in the next 12 months to 20%.

site_title: Ghost factories could be China’s new growth driver
summary: China is shifting its economic growth strategy to "ghost factories," where industrial equipment is manufactured and stored to boost GDP. The US-China tech cold war and trade tensions have led to a surge in demand for local equipment makers, such as Naura Technology Group and Advanced Micro-Fabrication Equipment. Despite lower GDP growth, industrial production figures are rising, with electrical machinery and equipment manufacturing posting double-digit growth. This approach allows China to maintain economic momentum while reducing reliance on foreign technology and boosting domestic industry.

images.alt_text: The survey showed expansion of both manufacturing output and new orders softened in June.
Demand in China remains lukewarm amid a bumpy post-Covid economic recovery.

site_title: World Bank chief aims to boost lending ability
summary: The Group of 20 (G20) finance ministers and central bank governors concluded a two-day gathering, with World Bank president Ajay Banga announcing plans to ramp up lending capacity while maintaining a top "AAA" credit rating. Banga proposed three new financing measures, including a portfolio guarantee programme, raising hybrid capital, and extracting more value from callable capital, to boost lending capacity. The World Bank aims to increase lending by $30 billion over 10 years with $5 in guarantees. Policymakers face pressure to address climate change and sustainable development goals, with the need for $3 trillion in financing per year by 2030.

images.alt_text: The finance ministers of the G20 countries gathered in the western Indian state of Gujarat, hoping to push for agreements on debt restructuring for vulnerable countries, global minimum taxation and reforms on multilateral development banks.

site_title: Pound heads for longest decline since Truss era
summary: The British pound has experienced its longest decline since the Liz Truss era, falling over 2% against the US dollar to approach $1.28. The decline is attributed to a bigger-than-expected fall in inflation, which has prompted traders to pare bets on further interest-rate hikes from the Bank of England, removing support for the currency. Traders now expect the BOE rate to peak at around 5.9% by February, and are uncertain about the central bank's next move. This marks a significant shift in market sentiment, with the pound facing headwinds in the second half of the year.

images.alt_text: Though the ECB looks at a range of currency measures beside the nominal effective rate, the common currency’s gains are starting to look precarious.

site_title: Taiwan's Powerchip targets listing in 5-7 years for Japan venture
summary: Taiwan's Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp (PSMC) plans to list a joint venture in Japan, which will build a factory to manufacture micro-controllers and power chips for Japanese companies, in 5-7 years. The factory's location is yet to be decided, but Kyushu is being considered due to its chipmaking hub status. Powerchip aims to attract government subsidies and additional funds from chip industry customers and financial investors. The move is part of a wave of investment in Japan to boost its chip manufacturing capabilities, following Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co's (TSMC) recent plant in Kyushu.

images.alt_text: Tokyo-based SBI is eyeing the growing financing needs of chipmakers to create redundant production lines as manufacturers bow to political and investor pressure to diversify their suppliers.
TSMC is viewed as among the earliest beneficiaries of efforts from the US to China to develop AI platforms.
“After evaluation, we do not expect the export restrictions on raw materials gallium and germanium will have any direct impact on TSMC’s production,” the company says.

site_title: The best bar in Asia is Hong Kong’s Coa – again
summary: Hong Kong's Coa has taken the top spot as the best bar in Asia for the third consecutive year, according to the Asia's 50 Best Bars list. Jigger & Pony in Singapore came in second, with Singapore bars dominating the list with 11 spots. The list, which was announced at a live event in Hong Kong, also recognized special awards, including the Michter's Art of Hospitality Award and the Altos Bartender's Bartender crown, which went to an all-female team at The Pontiac in Hong Kong.

images.alt_text: A bird's eye view from The Ritz-Carlton Osaka's Club Lounge.

site_title: Leading iFast to become truly global, Singapore Business Awards - THE BUSINESS TIMES
summary: iFast, a leading wealth management company, has received a trust business licence from the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). This licence allows iFast to expand its services and enhance its wealth management capabilities in the region. The MAS trust business licence enables iFast to provide a wider range of services, including trust formation, administration, and investment management. The move is expected to strengthen iFast's position in the Singaporean wealth management market, providing clients with access to a broader range of services and expertise. The licence is effective immediately.

site_title:
Podcasts win over audiences, and AI 
can help produce them
summary: Artificial intelligence is being used to augment news media, rather than fully automate publication, according to publishers at the INMA World Congress 2023. Podcasts are a key area of investment, with publishers finding success in engaging younger audiences. Text-to-speech technology is also being applied to stories, resulting in record-high engagement. AI charter frameworks are being developed to ensure human journalists review content before publication. To fully leverage AI, newsrooms must undergo transformations, develop complementary skills, and measure editorial and business impacts. Publishers are encouraged to "lean into" audio and AI to stay competitive.

images.alt_text: Editors Talk: Journalism is no longer just writing (Ep 3)
Christopher Lim, associate editor (product) of BT shares his key takeaways on AI, audio and newsroom transformation.
In the fight for supremacy, who emerges victorious? Singapore or Hong Kong?
A positive week for markets?

site_title: Made it in the corporate world and want to give back? The volunteer sector is a totally different animal
summary: A volunteer's journey can be a fulfilling path, but it differs from the corporate world. Joining a charity or organization, such as the Rotary movement, can help balance personal and professional life. Singapore's focus on holistic education and community work has encouraged volunteerism, with assessment criteria giving weight to community work and leadership qualities. Corporate involvement has also led to the concept of "corporate social responsibility," with companies recognizing the value of giving back to society. To start volunteering, identify a cause you're passionate about and approach relevant organizations. A servant leadership approach, focusing on others' needs, is key to successful volunteer work, and continuous learning is essential for growth.

images.alt_text: volunteer, hands, voluntarily
OCBC staff volunteer Pamela Peh working with Food from the Heart’s senior manager of IT and facilities Timothy Lai to analyse data for community shops.
Grooming leaders for a better tomorrow

site_title: ‘Finfluencers’ lead UK watchdog to tighten social media rules
summary: The UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) plans to update its social media guidance to deter "finfluencers" from promoting financial products that harm consumers. The FCA will ban incentives to invest in crypto, such as "refer a friend" bonuses, and require firms to introduce clear risk warnings and a 24-hour cooling period for first-time investors. The reforms aim to reflect the growing use of social media and target internet personalities posting ads that break the FCA's rules, with a consultation period running for eight weeks starting from October 8.

site_title: ADB cuts South-east Asia growth forecast for 2023 on weak manufacturing demand
summary: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has cut its growth forecast for South-east Asia in 2023 to 4.6% due to weaker external demand weighing on manufacturing output. Growth is expected to pick up to 4.9% in 2024, with Thailand's forecast revised upwards and those of Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines remaining unchanged. Experts attribute the downgrade to a decline in global demand for manufactured exports, with manufacturing supply chains shifting to the region and foreign direct investments rising.

images.alt_text: For the Asean+3 economies, Amro stuck to its April forecast and still expects the region to grow by a "robust" 4.6 per cent in 2023.
The Asian Development Bank cut China’s growth forecast for 2022 to 3.3 per cent from 5.0 per cent, as Beijing pursues a zero-Covid strategy that has devastated the world’s second-largest economy.

site_title: China June new home prices flat in weakest showing this year
summary: China's new home prices remained flat in June, marking the weakest showing this year, amid economic recovery falters. The sector has received policies to prop up the market, but uncertainty and persistent weakness have dented confidence. The central and local governments are expected to provide more stimulus at the ruling Communist Party's Politburo meeting later this month, with analysts calling for stronger policies to boost confidence and support home buying.

images.alt_text: China’s real estate crisis is stifling a recovery in the world’s second-largest economy, fuelling expectations for the government to take more steps to revive demand.
FILE PHOTO: A general view shows residential apartment blocks in Hong Kong, China, June 29, 2019. REUTERS/Thomas Peter/File Photo
Hong Kong is now seeking to revive the industry, in part by opening up for crypto firms and seeking to lure more family offices with tax breaks.
The average price of new homes in 100 cities fell 0.01 per cent in June, the same-sized decline that was seen in May, data from the China Index Academy shows.
The value of new home sales by the 100 biggest real estate developers falls 28.1 per cent to 526.74 billion yuan from a year earlier.

(FILES) This file photo taken on September 17, 2021 shows residential buildings in Beijing. - Pummelled by a housing crisis that caused a record-breaking slump in 2022, some Chinese property developers are starting to see light at the end of the tunnel, but analysts warn the sector is still on course to slow down in the long term. (Photo by GREG BAKER / AFP)

site_title: US envoy Kerry says climate cooperation could redefine US-China ties
summary: US climate envoy John Kerry said climate cooperation could redefine US-China ties, amid efforts to tackle global warming. Kerry met with China's top diplomat Wang Yi, describing their discussions as a "fresh start" for the two countries. Climate cooperation could provide a new definition of cooperation and capacity to resolve differences, Kerry said. The meeting marked the formal resumption in top-level climate diplomacy between the US and China, following Kerry's third visit to China as US climate envoy.

images.alt_text: U.S. Special Presidential Envoy for Climate John Kerry and Chinese top diplomat Wang Yi shake hands before a meeting at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China July 18, 2023. REUTERS/Florence Lo/Pool

site_title: A mixed bag of Moroccan flavours at Tajine
summary: Tajine Moroccan Tapas and Cocktail Bar, a new restaurant on Mohamed Sultan Road, offers a mixed bag of Moroccan flavors in a colorful and casual setting. The menu features a variety of dishes, including Moroccan salads, kefta, chicken pastilla, and tajines, but pricing is steep, with a light lunch for four costing around S$400. The restaurant's "Moroccan cheat sheet" section helps with unfamiliar ingredients, but ordering can be stressful due to pronunciation and ingredient confusion. Overall, Tajine is a good introduction to Moroccan cuisine, but may not be worth the high price for a full meal.

images.alt_text: Bottega Di Carna's botanical themed interiors.

site_title: Logan Paul, KSI energy drink Prime raises concerns for US kids
summary: Logan Paul and KSI's energy drink Prime Energy has raised concerns in the US about its high levels of caffeine, potentially hazardous for children. A single can contains 200mg of caffeine, more than a can of Coca-Cola or Red Bull. Medical experts warn that children under 12 should not consume caffeine and those between 12-18 should limit it to 100mg per day. US Senator Chuck Schumer has called for an investigation into the drink's caffeine levels and marketing strategy, citing "eye-popping levels of caffeine" for a child's body.

images.alt_text: Red Bull GmbH posted record revenue last year, selling more than 11 billion cans and giving it the biggest market for the category.
Soft drinks lose their fizz in Indonesia market as pandemic saps consumer demand
America's taste for hard seltzer is suddenly starting to wane
For digital creators, everything is for sale

site_title: Victoria bathing trail
summary: Victoria, Australia is home to over 100 natural mineral springs, with the highest concentration found in the towns of Daylesford and Hepburn, as well as the Mornington Peninsula. Alba Thermal Springs & Spa and Peninsula Hot Springs offer luxurious full-day self-care packages, private baths, and glamping stays amidst natural hot spring pools. The region also features historic bathhouses, such as the InterContinental Sorrento Mornington Peninsula's Aurora Spa & Bathhouse, and boutique accommodations like Hotel Vera in Ballarat, which offers personalized suites and a gourmet dining experience.

site_title: Hi-P International executive chairman wins top accolade at Singapore Business Awards, Singapore Business Awards - THE BUSINESS TIMES
summary: The 38th Singapore Business Awards honored top business leaders in Singapore, recognizing their outstanding contributions to the country's business community. The awards ceremony, held recently, acknowledged the achievements of 80 business leaders across various categories. Winners were chosen based on their exceptional leadership, innovation, and impact on the industry. The awards aim to inspire and motivate the business community, promoting excellence and growth in Singapore's business sector. The honorees were selected by a panel of judges and industry experts, highlighting the significance of their roles in driving Singapore's economy forward.

site_title: Chindata says largest shareholder Bain will not sell stake after rival bid
summary: Chindata Group Holdings announced that its largest shareholder, Bain Capital, will not sell its stake after a rival bid from China Merchants Capital. Bain, which owns about 87% of total voting power and 42% of outstanding shares, initially offered to buy the company for US$8 per share. However, following a competing bid of US$9.2 per share, Bain stated it remains committed to its original proposal, valuing the company at nearly US$3 billion.

site_title: Bank on hard token to secure your savings from Internet scammers
summary: Singapore banks are under pressure to secure customer savings from internet scammers. Since 2018, $2 billion has been lost to scams, with phishing attempts increasing by 165% in 2022. To prevent scammers from accessing internet banking, experts recommend using a hard token, which requires physical involvement to authorise transactions. However, banks are reluctant to issue physical tokens due to customer preference for digital tokens. Instead, banks have introduced measures such as 12-hour cooling periods and two-factor authentication to secure online banking access.

images.alt_text: When scammers can empty your bank accounts of S$8.5m in minutes, where is the sense of security?
SMS messages, which are not encrypted, can be intercepted and read by fraudsters in a number of ways.

site_title: Philippine central bank wants lenders to disclose climate assets
summary: The Philippines' central bank head, Eli Remolona, is pushing lenders to disclose climate-related assets as part of efforts to slow climate change. The central bank is developing a metric to score banks based on their climate-related assets and will make the scores public. Remolona also announced the central bank's goal to bring inflation back to its 2-4% target range, with headline inflation expected to fall within the goal by the fourth quarter and settle back to the target range early next year.

images.alt_text: Eli Remolona, who sits on the seven-man policy-making Monetary Board, will replace Felipe Medalla, as new Philippines central bank governor,  starting July.

site_title: Elon Musk says xAI will examine universe, work with Twitter and Tesla
summary: Elon Musk's company xAI aims to "understand the universe" by developing artificial general intelligence (AGI). Musk plans to use public tweets to train AI models and may collaborate with Twitter and Tesla on AI software. He has pushed for regulations in AI, citing concerns over companies like OpenAI and Google developing the technology without considering risks to humans. Musk also accused Twitter of allowing AI companies to use its data in an "illegal manner." xAI's mission is to build a "good AGI" as an alternative to existing AGI technologies.

images.alt_text: Elon Musk has warned for months about AI’s potential for “civilisational destruction”.
Twitter is trying to draw more content creators to the platform.

The FTC’s investigation into the wildly popular ChatGPT comes as artificial intelligence leaders have called for developers to hit the pause button on releasing AI tools to the public, warning the powerful technology could harm humanity.
FILE PHOTO: Tesla Model 3 vehicles are seen for sale at a Tesla facility in Fremont, California, U.S., May 23, 2023. REUTERS/Carlos Barria/File Photo
The remarks came on the same day that Musk launched his long-teased artificial intelligence startup, xAI, after arguing for months about AI’s potential for “civilisation destruction”.

site_title: Big banks are finally giving depositors a cut of windfall from Fed hikes
summary: US big banks are increasing deposits by offering higher interest rates, following a trend of depositors seeking higher returns elsewhere. Wells Fargo, JPMorgan Chase, and Citigroup reported a 46% increase in interest expense, as they compete to retain customers. Executives expect modest deposit declines across the industry, but are increasing payouts to consumers and institutional clients. Despite this, the banks' earnings from loans are rising, allowing them to maintain profitability.

images.alt_text: Lenders’ exposure to commercial real estate has come under growing scrutiny this year.
The moves are all part of Citigroup’s plans to improve its ratio of revenue to risk-weighted assets.

FILE PHOTO: Jamie Dimon, Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of JPMorgan Chase & Co., gestures as he speaks during an interview with Reuters in Miami, Florida, U.S., February 8, 2023. REUTERS/Marco Bello/File Photo
Wells Fargo reports profit of US$1.25 per share for the three months ended Jun 30.
Citi’s markets revenue falls 13 per cent to US$4.6 billion on more subdued activity in fixed income and equities.
JPMorgan’s profit climbs to US$14.47 billion, or US$4.75 per share, for the quarter ended Jun 30.

site_title: Singapore GDP growth likely to remain tepid after avoiding technical recession in Q2: economists
summary: Singapore's GDP growth is expected to remain tepid in the coming months, narrowly avoiding a technical recession in the second quarter. Economists predict a 0.7% year-on-year growth, driven by the services sector's 3% expansion, which helped offset the manufacturing sector's 7.5% contraction. While some economists expect a fragile recovery in the export-oriented manufacturing sector by Q3, others warn of lingering risks, including a potential slowdown in China's reopening pace and continued tight monetary policies in advanced economies.

images.alt_text: Singapore narrowly avoids technical recession in Q2 as GDP grows 0.7% year on year, 0.3% quarterly

site_title: Travelling gourmet - unforgettable dining experiences in far-flung places
summary: Four exceptional restaurants offer unforgettable dining experiences in remote locations. El Bulli in Spain, closed in 2011 but reopened as a museum, inspired a culinary revolution. Ynyshir in Wales, a four-and-a-half-hour drive from London, offers a unique dining destination with a focus on local ingredients and immersive experience. Nawaya in Japan's Tango Peninsula features seasonal ingredients and wood-fired cooking, while Terre in Ireland's Castlemartyr Resort offers a Michelin-starred tasting menu with French technique and Asian flavors. Lastly, Lodge in the Woods in Bali combines farm-to-table cuisine with harmony with nature, allowing guests to pick their own vegetables and interact with rescued animals.

site_title: Chanel’s sparkling ode to tweed
summary: Chanel has unveiled its expanded Tweed de Chanel High Jewellery collection, a 63-piece masterpiece that showcases the French maison's technical and aesthetic tour de force in crafting jewellery. The collection, inspired by the iconic tweed fabric, features five precious chapters, each representing a symbol dear to Mademoiselle Chanel. The pieces are characterized by their softness, comfort, and flexibility, with intricate designs and detailed craftsmanship. The collection is the brainchild of Patrice Leguéreau, director of the Chanel Fine Jewellery Creation Studio, who aimed to recreate the charms of tweed in precious metals and gems.

site_title: Photography platform Klaud9 owes payments to freelancers
summary: Klaud9, a Singapore-registered photography platform, owes payments to freelance photographers and videographers across Asia and Australia, with amounts owed ranging from A$1,200 to A$4,500. Freelancers have reported lengthy attempts to collect payments, with some receiving requests until the end of 2022, but none being paid. The platform remains operational, and some affected photographers have taken to leaving negative reviews. The company's co-founder, Isabel Gonzalez, cited the Covid-19 pandemic as a reason for the delays, but the platform has not commented on the issue.

images.alt_text: Multiple tales of breakthrough have echoed through the startup ecosystem, making any decision to shutter a tough one for founders to make.
The closure of one of Singapore’s most promising biotech companies raises larger implications for the city-state’s emerging ecosystem.

site_title: EU looks to take lead in metaverse world, avoid Big Tech dominance
summary: The European Commission has launched an initiative to take the lead in the metaverse, a shared virtual world accessible through the internet, while preventing Big Tech dominance. The EU aims to create an open and interoperable metaverse, reflecting EU values and fundamental rights, with a projected market size exceeding $1.18 trillion by 2030. The scheme includes bringing together creators, media companies, and others to create an industrial ecosystem, setting up regulatory sandboxes, and rolling out skills development programs and virtual public services.

site_title: Tesla's Shanghai factory workers welcome bonus increase after record deliveries
summary: Tesla's Shanghai factory workers have received a large increase in quarterly performance bonuses, with some workers receiving 1.5 times their monthly base salary. The move comes after the company cut bonuses for many staff in the previous quarter, following complaints from workers. The Shanghai plant, which employs around 20,000 workers, has seen record deliveries of 247,000 units of China-made electric vehicles in the second quarter. The workers' bonuses have been increased without explanation, but the move is seen as a positive step for the factory workers.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A gigafactory of electric carmaker Tesla Inc is seen in Shanghai, China October 18, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

site_title: Britain seeks to ramp up lithium production amid rising EV sales
summary: Britain is ramping up lithium production to meet the growing demand for electric vehicle (EV) batteries. The country's EV sales have risen steadily, with 267,000 units sold in 2022, accounting for about a sixth of total new car registrations. To address this, three companies - British Lithium, Cornish Lithium, and Northern Lithium - aim to produce 35,000 tonnes of lithium by 2030, which is below the projected domestic demand of 80,000 tonnes. The UK government is supporting domestic lithium production to reduce imports from China and promote the UK's advanced manufacturing industry.

images.alt_text: NEU Battery Materials, co-founded by Bryan Oh (left) and Kenneth Palmer (right), recently broke ground on a 150-square-metre recycling plant in Singapore.
John Goodenough became the oldest person to win a Nobel Prize when at the age of 97.

site_title: Of lucky charms, roses and rectangles
summary: Dior's latest fine jewelry collection, designed by Victoire de Castellane, features three distinct themes: Rose des Vents, La Rose Dior, and Gem Dior. The Rose des Vents collection combines nautical elements with roses and diamonds, while La Rose Dior draws inspiration from the curves and thorns of a rose stem. The Gem Dior collection, launched in 2021, features geometric motifs with rectangles in an irregular pattern. De Castellane's designs continue to showcase her bold and whimsical approach to jewelry, blending color, surrealism, and wonder.

site_title: A celebration of stones
summary: Luxury brands are showcasing a variety of materials in their latest collections, including diamonds, colourful gems, and ornamental stones. Tiffany's Blue Book 2023 High Jewellery collection features a platinum bracelet with aquamarines, tourmalines, and diamonds, while Bulgari's The Birth of Venus bracelet combines pink gold, mother-of-pearl, and diamonds. Dior's Les Jardins de la Couture collection features white opals and gemstones in pink, blue, and yellow hues. Other brands, such as Chanel and Gucci, are also using unique materials and colours in their high jewellery pieces, including asymmetrical earrings and ornamental stones.

site_title: Go big or go home: show-stopping necklaces for very special occasions
summary: Luxury brands have unveiled their latest High Jewellery collections, featuring show-stopping necklaces that are sure to make a statement at big events. The collections include pieces from Chanel, Tiffany & Co, Gucci, Dior, Louis Vuitton, and Bulgari, each showcasing unique designs and precious gems. The necklaces range from the Tweed Royal by Chanel, featuring a 10.17-carat diamond and a detachable lion's head, to the Seeds necklace by Louis Vuitton, featuring succulent-looking rubellite and spessartite garnet cabochons.

site_title: Welcome to the club
summary: The Ritz-Carlton Club Experience offers an elevated level of hospitality, curating activities and immersing guests in local culture at its Asia-Pacific properties. The Ritz-Carlton Osaka's Club Lounge features a tranquil living and dining space with a complete buffet spread, afternoon tea, and post-dinner cordials. Guests can also enjoy complimentary activities such as a running/cycling tour to Osaka Castle, a walking tour of Nakanoshima Park, and a Japanese tea ceremony. The Ritz-Carlton Tokyo's Club Lounge offers a stunning view of Mount Fuji and Tokyo Bay, with a generous dining program and exclusive activities like a wine-tasting session and relaxing massage at the spa.

site_title: MPA calls for proposals to design, promote adoption of full-electric harbour craft in Singapore
summary: The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) has launched an expression of interest (EOI) to design and promote the adoption of full-electric harbour craft in Singapore. The EOI aims to assess and validate proposals for the best and most cost-effective reference designs, focusing on smaller harbour craft initially. MPA hopes to reduce upfront premiums and operating costs, supporting the development of green financing options and enhancing the skills of the maritime workforce. The proposals must demonstrate commercial viability and scalability by September 15.

images.alt_text: Singapore’s Maritime and Port Authority has announced some updates on shipping decarbonisation projects, in conjunction with Singapore Maritime Week from Apr 24 to 28.
In Asia, demand for biofuels and renewable fuels is growing but varies across markets.
The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore will collaborate with Shell Eastern Trading to support the adoption of electric harbour craft.

site_title: A new era in diamond transparency
summary: Tiffany & Co. has launched a new era in diamond transparency, disclosing the provenance and craftsmanship journey of its individually registered diamonds. The company, a premier purveyor of diamonds, has been handcrafting beautiful specimens since 1848. It sources diamonds from countries such as Botswana, Canada, and South Africa, and employs 1,500 expert cutters and polishers in its state-of-the-art workshops. Tiffany's Diamond Source Initiative provides consumers with geographic sourcing information specific to their diamond, ensuring the stones are among the most responsibly sourced in the world. The company's commitment to transparency and quality is reflected in its triple-excellent cut diamonds, which are crafted with unparalleled expertise and precision.

site_title: Bangles for your buck
summary: A bangle can elevate any outfit, serving as a versatile accessory for both formal and casual occasions. High Jewellery, such as Chanel's Comète Volute bracelet, offers luxurious and signature pieces like the diamond-studded shooting star design. Bangles can instantly dress up or down, making them a must-have for women's wardrobes. Whether for a special event or everyday wear, incorporating a bangle into one's style can add a touch of elegance and sophistication.

site_title: Europe: Shares hit 14-week low on rate hike jitters
summary: Europe's shares hit a 14-week low on Thursday, falling 2.3% to 2.9% as investors worried about further interest rate hikes globally. The US private payrolls report showed a strong labor market, exacerbating concerns about higher rates. The EURO Stoxx 50 index plummeted 2.9%, with France's CAC 40 falling 3.1%. Technology and real estate stocks also declined, while FinecoBank rose 6.0% after seeing inflows of 765 million euros in June.

images.alt_text: The Euro Stoxx 50 index closed 0.9 per cent lower, its worst session since the end of May, while the broader Stoxx 600 dropped 0.7 per cent.

site_title: Mondrian’s hotel dining gets celebrity push
summary: Bottega di Carna, a restaurant within the Mondrian Singapore hotel, has been launched with celebrity chef consultant Dario Cecchini lending his name. Despite the celebrity hook, the solid cooking team led by Alastair Clayton and Kenny Huang is the main focus. The restaurant's botanical-themed interior and efficient service are notable highlights. The menu features a limited selection of predictable cuts, including steak, and well-executed dishes such as steak tartare, zucchini noodles, and octopus. The restaurant stands well on its own, with a rating of 7, and is a good option for all-day dining with a modern Italian touch.

images.alt_text: Vitello tonnato is reimagined as a tuna sashimi tart with strawberries and veal sauce.

site_title: Dr SK Tan: At 76, aesthetics doctor still going strong
summary: Dr. SK Tan, known as the "grandfather of Singapore aesthetics," remains active at 76, running his clinic IDS (Innovative Dermatological Solutions) and skincare line. He attributes his success to excellence and integrity, advising others to prioritize these values over financial gain. Dr. Tan credits his wife, Janifer, as the driving force behind their business success, and together they have expanded into various ventures, including restaurants, bars, and real estate. Despite his significant business accomplishments, Dr. Tan emphasizes the importance of planning for his company's future and ensuring a smooth transition in his absence.

images.alt_text: Yeo Yann Yann in dress by Bottega Veneta and necklace, earrings and ring by Tiffany & Co.

hyluxeanurag14 - Anurag Srivastava in shirt, suit & tie by Thom Browne

Credit : IVANHO HARLIM/BT
Conditions for usage: Free with credit

site_title: Top Asia IPO gainers are in Japan as nation lures global funds
summary: Japan's initial public offerings (IPOs) have delivered the biggest gains among newly listed Asian shares this year, with debutants rising an average of 75% since their listings. This surpasses other major Asian markets with at least $1 billion raised through IPOs. The Japanese IPO market is seen as attractive due to the country's weak yen, corporate governance reforms, and the Bank of Japan's easy monetary policy. The top performers include Rakuten Bank and SBI Sumishin Net Bank, which have seen valuations increase by over 30% since their IPOs.

images.alt_text: Wage growth is one of the key trends the Bank of Japan is closely watching as it considers if and when it should unwind its ultra-loose monetary stimulus.

site_title: Mooncakes and cocktails for every taste
summary: In celebration of the Mid-Autumn Festival, PARKROYAL COLLECTION Marina Bay offers a range of mooncakes with reusable cases that can be upcycled, while Pan Pacific Singapore's new bar PLUME features indigenous bird-inspired cocktails and a locally-inspired menu. The bar's exclusive drinks, such as the Pink-Necked Green Pigeon, are designed to reflect the individual birds. Meanwhile, the hotel's Moonlit Pavilion mooncake gift set can be transformed into a bedside lamp. Pre-orders for the mooncakes are now open, with purchases available from July 24 to September 29.

site_title: IAEA endorses Japan plan to release treated Fukushima water
summary: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has endorsed Japan's plan to release treated Fukushima water into the sea over several decades, stating it is consistent with international safety standards and will have a negligible radiological impact. The plan, which involves diluting the water and releasing it into the sea, has been provisionally endorsed by the IAEA and will proceed after a comprehensive review by the agency's chief.

images.alt_text: Japan has assured other nations that the release of the water is safe, is in line with standard industry practice and that it’s necessary, because about 1,000 storage tanks at Fukushima will hit capacity early in 2024.

site_title: US trade deficit narrows as imports of merchandise decline
summary: The US trade deficit narrowed in May to $69 billion, a 7.3% decline from the previous month, as imports of merchandise decreased by 2.3%. This drop is attributed to American consumers reducing spending on goods and opting for services and experiences instead. Total exports also fell 0.8% in May, with shipments of food and feeds declining. The smaller deficit may have contributed to economic growth in the second quarter, but economists do not expect trade to provide the same support to the economy as in the past due to easing demand abroad.

images.alt_text: The US labour market has remained resilient despite 500 basis points worth of interest rate hikes from the Fed since March 2022.

site_title: UK unemployment climbs as inflation weighs on economy
summary: UK unemployment rose to 4% in the three months to May, up from 3.8% in April, according to official data. Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt described the jobs market as "strong" despite the increase, noting that unemployment is low by historical standards. The economy struggles with high inflation, with the rate of job growth slowing. The rate of 4% is the same as it was in 2022, marking a return to pre-pandemic levels.

images.alt_text: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt holds a Ministerial Statement at the House of Commons in London, Britain, June 26, 2023. UK Parliament/Jessica Taylor/Handout via REUTERS THIS IMAGE HAS BEEN SUPPLIED BY A THIRD PARTY MANDATORY CREDIT. IMAGE MUST NOT BE ALTERED.
FILE PHOTO: Woman holds British Pound banknotes in this illustration taken May 30, 2022. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

site_title: Osaka calling
summary: Osaka, Japan's third-largest city, is gaining popularity among travelers, who are drawn to its laid-back vibe, friendly people, and affordable prices. The city offers a unique blend of history, culture, and entertainment, with attractions like Osaka Castle, Shitennoji temple, and Universal Studios Japan. Foodies will enjoy the city's culinary offerings, including okonomiyaki, takoyaki, and Michelin-starred restaurants like La Cime and Tempura Hiraishi. The city's retro atmosphere can be experienced in Shinsekai and Dotonbori, with their nostalgic billboards and lively food streets. With its proximity to Kyoto and Nara, Osaka is an ideal base for exploring western Japan.

images.alt_text: Chablis is an excellent alternative to more expensive white burgundies.

site_title: The food and art of Daniele Sperindio
summary: Daniele Sperindio's Michelin-starred restaurant, Art di Daniele Sperindio, has undergone a rebranding with revamped dishes, including a tuna sashimi tart with strawberries and veal sauce, a reimagined version of the classic vitello tonnato. The restaurant, located in the National Gallery, Singapore, offers lunch and dinner services from Tuesday to Sunday. The rebranding showcases the chef's creative take on traditional Italian cuisine, elevating the dining experience to a new level.

images.alt_text: Quietly opulent interiors of Restaurant Fiz.

site_title: The future of trade is digital
summary: Singapore has adopted the use of electronic bills of lading (eBLs), a digital equivalent of traditional paper-based bills, to support the country's digital transformation as a financial and maritime hub. The move is expected to benefit the shipping industry by reducing transaction times, costs, and fraud risks. With the adoption of eBLs, Singapore aims to unlock up to US$40 billion in global trade and support the development of a universal eBL standard, which could save the industry US$6.5 billion in documentation costs.

images.alt_text: 新加坡港口。港务集团的集装箱码头。

site_title: Sembcorp Industries drops plan to sell its waste-management business
summary: Sembcorp Industries has decided not to sell its waste-management business and energy-from-waste plant, terminating discussions with potential bidders KKR and Macquarie Asset Management. The company had initially confirmed the potential sale in June and seen its shares hit an eight-year high. After the Reuters report, Sembcorp Industries stated that the divestment was part of its "ongoing strategic initiatives to maximise shareholder value". The company will continue to review its portfolio to ensure strategic fit and maximize shareholder value.

images.alt_text: Gentari chief renewables officer Low Kian Min and Sembcorp Singapore and SEA chief Koh Chiap Khiong ink the MOU.
The arbitration is not expected to have a material impact on the company's earnings per share or net tangible assets per share.
Reuters had reported in May that HSBC was hired to run the sale of the unit.
Sembcorp Industries' statement comes in response to a Reuters article about the potential sale of the group's waste and recycling management unit, SembWaste.

SembWaste is one of three public waste collectors appointed by Singapore’s National Environment Agency to provide waste and recyclable collection services to residential, schools and trade premises in the city-state, according to its website.

site_title: Hong Kong’s reopening brings scant gains for financial hub
summary: Hong Kong's six-month reopening has yielded limited gains, with the city still struggling to regain its status as Asia's premier finance and tourism hub. The city has introduced tax breaks for wealthy individuals and family offices, and is opening up to crypto firms, but a significant workforce decline due to the Covid regime and national security law has hindered its recovery. Labour shortages remain a major issue, and the city's efforts to revive its reputation through high-level events and visa programs have yet to yield substantial results.

images.alt_text: hong kong Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg
Cathay Pacific Airways is also recruiting more crew from mainland China as it struggles to fill roles locally.
Sales increase to HK$34.5 billion (S$6 billion), marking a sixth consecutive month of growth.

site_title: Europe: Stocks start week on steady footing, China worries linger
summary: European stocks ended 0.2% higher on Monday, rebounding from their worst weekly performance in almost four months. The travel & leisure sector led gains, limiting the impact of weak Chinese inflation data. China's producer prices fell at their fastest pace in over seven years, while consumer prices teetered on the edge of deflation. Shares in China-exposed miners slid 0.6% as metal prices dipped.

site_title: UK investors pull US$842 million from equity funds in June
summary: UK investors withdrew $842.2 million from equity funds in June, the largest outflow since September 2022, amid rising interest rates and recession fears. The outflow was driven by a flight to safety, with investors favoring fixed income and money market funds. Property funds and funds focused on environmental, social, and governance issues (ESG) also saw significant outflows, with £503 million and £369 million withdrawn, respectively. The trend is attributed to market volatility and concerns over the impact of interest rate hikes on the economy.

images.alt_text: A FTSE share index board in the atrium of the London Stock Exchange Group Plc's offices in London, UK, on Friday, Aug. 12, 2022. London Stock Exchange Plc Chief Executive Officer Julia Hoggett said the IPO pipeline in London remains robust, despite a slowdown this year that’s been felt at many exchanges globally. Photographer: Jose Sarmento Matos/Bloomberg

site_title: Taylor Swift tickets queue crosses 1 million within 10 minutes; all UOB presale tickets sold out
summary: Taylor Swift's pre-sale concert tickets for her Eras Tour in March 2024 sold out within 10 minutes, with over 1 million virtual queue numbers issued. All UOB presale tickets were sold out, with ticket prices ranging from S$108 to S$348. The event will take place at the National Stadium from March 2-4 and 7-9, 2024, with over 300,000 fans expected to attend. The high demand for tickets has boosted the economy, with UOB card applications increasing significantly in the weeks leading up to the pre-sale.

images.alt_text:
(FILES) US singer-songwriter Taylor Swift performs onstage on the first night of her "Eras Tour" at AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, on March 31, 2023. Music megastars Taylor Swift and The Weeknd are among showbiz people invited to join the organization that votes on who gets Oscars, the body said on June 28.
Other invitees include Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, who directed "Everything Everywhere All at Once," which won seven Oscars this year including the prize for best picture.
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said its new crop of members of Tinseltown's most elite club numbers 398 people. (Photo by SUZANNE CORDEIRO / AFP)

site_title: New and refreshed SkillsFuture programmes help companies, workers update digital skills
summary: Singapore's SkillsFuture initiative is revamping its programs to help workers upgrade their digital skills amid frequent tech disruptions. The refreshed SkillsFuture for Digital Workplace (SFDW) 2.0 program, relaunched with a 70% subsidy for course fees, focuses on four key areas: automation, cybersecurity, data analytics, and digital tools. The program aims to build a skills ecosystem that is agile and responsive to individual and enterprise needs. Additionally, SkillsFuture is broadening its reach to more vulnerable groups, including small and medium-sized enterprises, and preserving the employability of mid-career workers.

images.alt_text: Skillsfuture Forum 2023- Chan Chun Sing, Minister for Education

site_title: US dollar gives up Fed gains; yen and pound strengthen
summary: The US dollar index fell 0.3% to 103.03, giving up gains from the Federal Reserve's June meeting minutes, which showed policymakers expect further tightening in US monetary policy. The yen and pound strengthened, with the yen rising 0.5% against the US dollar, as investors sought safe-haven assets amid concerns about global growth and risk appetite. The Bank of England is expected to raise interest rates to 6.5% early next year, supporting the pound.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: U.S. dollar banknotes are seen in this illustration taken March 10, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

site_title: Tudor Prince makes a surprise comeback
summary: Tudor is reviving the classic 1976 Tudor "Big Block" Chronograph, the Tudor Prince Chronograph One, for the Only Watch 2023 charity auction. The watch is crafted from 18-carat yellow gold and features a new in-house chronograph movement, the MT59XX. This unique piece marks the debut of the MT59XX movement and is a rare opportunity for fans of the Prince. Estimated to sell for CHF 25,000 to CHF 35,000, the watch will benefit research on Duchenne and genetic diseases.

site_title:
Pay attention to the human 
aspect of going digital
summary: Singaporean companies should proactively manage change and build a culture of innovation to help older employees combine experience with new skills, addressing the shortening skill lifespans. Experts emphasize the importance of micro-learning, reskilling, and upskilling, and leveraging the bigger ecosystem for digital transformation. Companies can borrow from external resources, automate processes, and invest in reskilling workers to retain talent, which is more cost-effective than acquiring new workers. The government also plays a crucial role in supporting businesses through grants and programs like SkillsFuture, which can help bridge the skills gap and promote lifelong learning.
